content: बलं [बल्-अच्] {@--1@} Strength, power, might, vigour. {@--2@} Force, violence; as in बलात् <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--3@} An army, host, forces, troops; भवेदभीष्ममद्रोणं धृतराष्ट्रबलं कथं <ls>Ve. 3. 24</ls>, <ls n="Ve. 3.">43</ls>; <ls>Bg. 1. 10</ls>; <ls>R. 16. 37.</ls> {@--4@} Bulkiness, stoutness (of the body). {@--5@} Body, figure, shape. {@--6@} Semen virile, {@--7@} Blood, {@--8@} Gum myrrh. {@--9@} A shoot, sprout. (बलेन means ‘on the strength of’, ‘by means or virtue of’; बहुबलेन जितः, वीर्यबलेन &c.; बलात् ‘perforce’, ‘forcibly’, ‘violently’, ‘against one's will’; बलान्निद्रा समायाता <ls>Pt. 1</ls>; हृदयमदये तस्मिन्नेवं पुनर्वलते बलात् <ls>Gīt. 7</ls>). --लः {@--1@} A crow. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of the elder brother of Kṛṣṇa; see वलराम below. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of a demon killed by Indra.
